conclusion: Objects A and B are two pieces of cloth in different colors.
Objects C, D, E, and F are building blocks: C is pink, D is yellow, E is white-blue, and F is dark blue.
Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F.

premise: Objects A and B are cloths, and gravity acts on them.
conclusion: Objects A and B will fall straight downward because of gravity.

premise: Objects A and B fall straight downward and encounter objects C, D, E, and F.
conclusion: As they reach the table, each top cloth will drape over whatever rigid shape happens to be underneath it.

premise: Cloth A falls and encounters objects C and D.
conclusion: Cloth covering C and D (left side) will sag until it touches the pink block C first, and then the taller yellow block D.

premise: Cloth B falls and encounters objects E and F.
conclusion: Cloth covering E and F (right side) will sag until it touches the slanted white-blue block E first and then the taller solid blue block F.

premise: The cloths have settled over the blocks.
conclusion: Once the cloths are fully settled, the lower parts of the cloths will be resting directly on the tops and vertical faces of the blocks.

premise: The cloths have come to rest on the blocks.
conclusion: No further motion occurs after they come to rest; the blocks simply stay hidden under the cloths.

premise: The cloths fall, drape over the blocks, and come to rest.
conclusion: Each cloth falls, drapes itself over the blocks beneath it, and comes to rest with its lowest points lying on the upper surfaces of the corresponding blocks (C & D on the left, E & F on the right).
